lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
* Represents a dialog box consisting of an ImageView and a Label.
* Uses fx:root in DialogBox.fxml and sets controller/root in constructor.
* Constructs a DialogBox with given text and image.
assert text != null : "Dialog text must not be null";
assert img != null : "Display image must not be null";
assert false : "FXML loading failed for " + FXML_PATH;
assert dialog != null : "Dialog label must be injected";
assert displayPicture != null : "DisplayPicture must be injected";
* Flips the dialog box such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.
assert getChildren() != null : "DialogBox children must not be null";
// Reverse the children manually (instead of stream)
* Factory method for creating user dialog.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
assert text != null : "User dialog text must not be null";
assert img != null : "User dialog image must not be null";
* Factory method for creating Sakura's dialog (flipped layout).
public static DialogBox getSakuraDialog(String text, Image img) {
assert text != null : "Sakura dialog text must not be null";
assert img != null : "Sakura dialog image must not be null";
* FriendlyBotSakura is a simple flower-themed task manager bot.
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* Called by FXML when user hits Enter or clicks Send.
* Handles reading and writing tasks to storage.
* Constructs a Storage object for the specified file path.
* @param filePath the path of the file to load and save tasks
* Loads tasks from the storage file into an ArrayList of {@link Task}.
* Supports ToDo, Deadline, and Event tasks. If the file does not exist,
* an empty task list is returned.
Task eventTask = new Event(parts[2], parts[3], parts[4]);
System.out.println("Unknown task type in storage: " + taskType);
System.out.println("Storage file not found. Starting with an empty list.");
* Clears the contents of the storage file.
* This method overwrites the existing file with an empty string
try (FileWriter writer = new FileWriter(filePath, false)) { // overwrite
* Saves a list of tasks to the storage file.
* Each task is written in a specific format.
* @param tasks the ArrayList of tasks to save
* Represents a Deadline task: a subclass of Task class
